Description: Ostracon, fragment (two pieces joined) of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is partially grey in section, the interior is covered with traces of a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is grooved in a number of places, covered with a red-brown slip and remains of sixteen lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing part of a letter.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.95)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87600) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87600)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 102 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
